stream_context.summary: Kaze live-codes Course 11 "Ice Castle," fixing visual bugs in the oil-factory sub-area and building the new Freezy enemy while discussing physics tweaks, star-count structure, and future difficulty modes.

development_findings.summary: Course 11 (Ice Castle) is now the main focus; Courses 13–15 remain to be built, so the hack is roughly two-thirds finished.
development_findings.quote: We are working on course 11 of 13, the ice castle… I was really busy working on the oil level and the new video so not much progress has been made here.

development_findings.summary: Implemented a ‘spline light’ system: dynamic lights follow moving platforms and cast colored glow, giving the N64 engine a modern feel.
development_findings.quote: I invented the spline light… you see how the dots move depending on how the platform moves—that was Biobak’s idea.

development_findings.summary: Camera logic has been re-written for tight spaces; Kaze demos a secret tunnel where the camera “just works” without clipping.
development_findings.quote: Have you ever seen a camera like this in a Mario game? Unbelievable.

development_findings.summary: Encountered a visual-effects regression in the oil factory: the room-darkening shader no longer triggers; Kaze flags it for off-stream debugging.
development_findings.quote: You were supposed to talk to him and then the whole room gets darker… The effect is missing. This really really sucks.

development_findings.summary: Designing the Freezy enemy: suction phase pulls in snow, then fires ice shards that can freeze Mario; particle system prototyped on stream.
development_findings.quote: This thing blows and it should suck… Next we need to make some ice shards and an ice block. I need to freeze Mario’s animation.

development_findings.summary: Considering nerfing the ground-pound dive: limit angle change (~30°) to stop advanced players trivialising jumps while preserving feel.
development_findings.quote: Maybe a better way … you can’t really change your angle with it anymore. I can change my angle slightly, maybe 30 degrees.

development_findings.summary: Performance mindset: every conditional costs ≈0.1 µs; UI elements are dynamically disabled to keep frame budget; F3DX chosen over F3D for speed.
development_findings.quote: That’s why I can add UI elements with just 0.1 microseconds of performance loss while they’re inactive.

development_findings.summary: Planned star structure: ~130 core stars plus Yoshi ‘comet’ missions and optional hunts, targeting ~180 total; only 3-4 100-coin stars.
development_findings.quote: Looks like it’s going to be 180 stars… 100-coin stars—there would be 3, actually 4 in the entire game.

development_findings.summary: Difficulty/accessibility discussion: possible ‘sight-seeing mode’ lowering speed & gravity instead of changing HP; also option to respawn on last ground contact.
development_findings.quote: If we have a sightseeing mode… make Mario 20 % slower but also reduce gravity and jump velocity.

development_findings.summary: Long-term schedule: with courses, extras and polishing, Kaze estimates another ~2 years of work.
development_findings.quote: We’re in course 13 out of 15, so we’re almost done already—well, almost done. It’s probably still going to be like two years.

context_findings.summary: Kaze and Zeina expect their daughter Reyna in four weeks; parental leave will temporarily increase stream frequency.
context_findings.quote: My daughter will be born in four weeks… I will likely stream a little more.

context_findings.summary: Reyna is named after Zeina’s childhood friend who died at 12; the choice reflects personal tribute.
context_findings.quote: She’s named after a friend of mine that passed away when I was 12 years old.

context_findings.summary: Kaze despises video editing; looking to hire an editor at $16 per minute to release more videos.
context_findings.quote: My YouTube output is so hard bottlenecked by my unwillingness to make videos.

context_findings.summary: He worries about Nintendo takedowns—70 of his videos were removed—and would distrust any official invitation.
context_findings.quote: If Nintendo ever sent me a job offer… I would think it’s a ploy to get me arrested.

context_findings.summary: Philosophy on level design: wants ‘choose your own difficulty’ where risky jumps reward skilled players but casuals have safe routes.
context_findings.quote: I want the game to be pick-your-own difficulty where you can go for risky jumps or you can do the easy thing whenever you want.

biobak.summary: Proposed moving light-particle dots with platforms, directly inspiring the new spline light effect.
biobak.quote: You see how the dots move depending on how the platform moves—that was Biobak’s idea.

biobak.summary: Suggested adding speed-line UI effect cheaply using Kaze’s optimized overlay system.
biobak.quote: Means you can add speed lines for free.

biobak.summary: Provided feedback on enemy spacing (amps) and general art style during level review.

zeina.summary: Joined voice chat briefly; shared personal story behind the baby’s name Reyna.
zeina.quote: Reyna is named after a friend of mine that passed away when I was 12 years old.

zeina.summary: Agreed on merchandise idea: matching caps with ‘Z’ (Zeina) and ‘R’ (Reyna).

key_stories.title: Bug in the Oil Factory
key_stories.summary: A secret generator room was meant to darken when the NPC speaks, but the shader vanished between builds. Kaze replicates the issue live, vows off-stream fix.
key_stories.process: Traced through event scripts; confirmed callback never fires.
key_stories.outcome: Flagged for off-stream debugging; lighting system to be reviewed.
key_stories.key_quote: The effect is missing. This really really sucks.

key_stories.title: Re-balancing the Dive Move
key_stories.summary: Another designer convinced Kaze the versatile ground-pound dive undermines level difficulty. He prototypes a nerfed version limiting mid-air steering.
key_stories.challenge: Advanced players trivialise jumps; casuals rarely use the move.
key_stories.process: Adjusted code to cap angle change at ~30°, tested in Ice Castle.
key_stories.outcome: New physics feel promising; community feedback pending.
key_stories.key_quote: Maybe a better way… you can’t really change your angle with it anymore.

key_stories.title: Birth of the Freezy Enemy
key_stories.summary: Kaze creates a new foe that inhales snow, then exhales ice shards to freeze Mario. He iterates on particles, hitboxes and freezing animation in real time.
key_stories.challenge: Needed a unique ice enemy with clear telegraphing and feedback.
key_stories.process: Built custom particle emitter, experimented with cone vs cylinder shapes, tweaked suction logic and Mario’s frozen state.
key_stories.outcome: Prototype functions; visuals and damage tuning to continue off-stream.
key_stories.key_quote: This thing blows and it should suck… next we need to make some ice shards and an ice block.

open_questions.context: Kaze brainstorms extra 45 stars inspired by Galaxy comets and SA1 emerald hunts but is unsure how to integrate them.

open_questions.context: Sight-seeing mode (slower Mario, lower gravity) floated; alternative respawn system discussed.
